fields.description: This probably should warn the user that the login UI would be affected when public sign up is being enabled and the external user flag is off.
fields.summary: Warn Google Apps instances without external users that the login UI changes when public sign up is enabled

fields.description:
Our process for integrating upstream products into Studio requires occasionally patching certain files in the original webapps. Mostly, this is for configuration files. For example, we often add extra loggers.

Right now the process of regenerating the patches when we want to change something, or when the upstream file changes enough that the patch can't apply cleanly anymore, is pretty manual and painful. We should invest some time into scripting a solution that can do three-way diffs between the original upstream version, the new upstream version, and our modified version so we can do the equivalent of a git or hg rebase and generate a new patch to apply the desired changes to the current upstream version cleanly.
fields.summary: Streamline patch generation

fields.description:
As of JIRA Studio 2.3, it is possible to use Bamboo's Grails builder with a Studio build, but it is a bit of a hassle:

# Grails is not installed on the default AMI, so customers need to create an EBS volume to install it on
# Customer admins do not have permission to configure builders in Studio, so they will need to create a support request with the path to their Grails installation to have a support engineer configure the builder for them.

The next version of Bamboo should have Grails pre-installed on the default AMI (http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-5823) so it might be a good idea to have a Grails builder available by default, to avoid the need for a support request.
fields.summary: Support the Grails builder by default

fields.description:
Compare the results of http://stage.jira.com/fake and http://stage.jira.com/fake.jspa

The former shows a normal Tomcat 404 page, but the latter shows the HTML source of that page. This is because the response has Content-Type: text/plain. The difference appears to be whether the request is handled by the WebWork dispatcher or not.

fields.description:
Blitz test feedback:

bq. Clicking on "add user" in Studio takes me out of JIRA studio  to Google apps page for adding a user.  There is no way to navigate back to studio if I change my mind about adding a user.  Is there a way to have this open a new tab instead of navigating me away from Studio in that window?  Even if I hit back, I'm asked to log in again.  All I did was change my mind and now I have to hit the back button a couple of times and log in again.
fields.summary: Link to Google for adding a user should open in a new window

fields.description:
When you add a new favourite in Confluence, it shows up on the Confluence dashboard right away, but there is a slight delay before it appears in the activity bar wiki favourites tab.

The activity bar uses an RSS feed to retrieve the list of favourites, and this delay appears to be the normal delay Confluence has before indexing content.

I'm not sure how the list is retrieved on the dashboard, if not through the index. Maybe there's another way to get them for the activity bar, too.
fields.summary: Activity bar doesn't show new Confluence favourites right away
Untranslated breadcrumb configuring space application links

fields.description:
This is probably part of the App Links plugin, but it was reported in Studio so I'll file it here first.

Go to or create a personal space in Studio, then go to Space Admin. There is an Application Links section in the left menu. Choose JIRA Project, choose an instance, and a project key, and click Associate.

A button labeled "Synchronize" appears. This should use Australian spelling to conform to Atlassian standards: "Synchronise"
fields.summary: American spelling in app links "synchronize" button

fields.description:
In previous versions, going to a Google app on a domain integrated with Studio (e.g., http://mail.atl-paid-dev.com/), clicking the More menu at the top, and choosing JIRA Studio would log you right in to Studio. If you didn't have a current Studio session, it would jump right to the OpenID dance and log you in without prompting (because there is an active Google login session).

Now if you do it, and you don't have a current JIRA Studio session, it takes you to the page where you choose Google or external user login. It can be assumed that the user is a Google user, so this is an unnecessary step.

The URL that this link redirects to is configured in HAMS, and I don't think it will be easy to change that without breaking things in the meantime. Can the login choice page live on another URL and have login.jsp be the Google login redirect?

Otherwise, can we detect whether there is an active Google login session somehow?

If neither of these are possible without causing other problems, then we'll have to live with this for the initial 2.3 launch and change the redirect on the website after deployment.
fields.summary: Google OneBar JIRA Studio link should log you straight in

2010-08-31 20:32:56,127 SyncServiceThread-Thread-4 WARN      [users.mgmt.jira.UserServiceImpl] OpenID for user veenu changed. Possible removed by Google. Renaming users is not supported in Studio.
{noformat}

This is apparently normal when the poller runs, because it does not include the OpenID for each user in the response.

It would be nice to fix up the log message while we're in there:
* "Possible" -> "Possibly"
* The log says "removed" when the OpenID is missing and "renamed" when it changes, but always says "Renaming users is not supported" either way.

fields.description:
bq. I created a Google user first and then an external user. I didn't realise that the GApps user wouldn't be properly created and the conflict raised until they tried to sign in for the first time. It worked fine then and the conflict was detected, but it meant that the external user got to take the username even though I created them second.

We could solve this by checking Google to see if the username exists at the time when users are added.
fields.summary: External users added to JIRA Studio can conflict with existing Google users

fields.description:
Currently there is a LifecycleAware class in integration-jira-plugin to disable public sign up everytime JIRA is started. We should remove this to allow Gapps-enabled Studio to open for public sign up.

Publicly signed up users should be treated as external users.
fields.summary: Allow customer to enable public sign up for Gapps-enabled Studio

fields.description:
I would like to be able to disable user accounts, rather than delete them. This would be useful when a employee or contractor leaves. Especially, contract developers we sometime have them on for a project, and bring them back later for another project. 

I don't necessarily want to delete and recreate everything. I don't necessarily want to reassign everything to someone else.

Also, Since this is "publicly accessible" on the internet, if someone is terminated I may need to have their account disabled at a moments notice without having a person to reassign their issues to.
fields.summary: As an Jira Studio Administrator, I would like to be able to disable/lock user accounts.

fields.description: JiraUserServiceImpl is a result of AOD-2656 and AOD-2801. It represents the user-related functionality for the JIRA DB used in the access level step in the importer. It can be easily encapsulated and tested by mocking up com.atlassian.studio.importer.impl.user.JiraUserServiceImpl.AccessProvider and com.atlassian.studio.importer.impl.user.JiraUserServiceImpl.UserProvider.
fields.summary: Write unit test for com.atlassian.studio.importer.impl.user.JiraUserServiceImpl
Functional tests for user synchronisation upon reprovision

fields.description: PredictingLicenseService calculates a license prediction depending on the users imported in JIRA minus the users already imported into Crowd (retrieved via StudioLicenseUserUtil). In other words, it predicts the license state after the current import file / JIRA users have been imported into Crowd. This functionality has been added in AOD-2661. The service should be relatively stable by now, only com.atlassian.studio.importer.user.JiraUserService and com.atlassian.studio.jira.license.StudioLicenseUserUtil have to be mocked up in order to isolate the unit.
fields.summary: Write unit test for com.atlassian.studio.importer.impl.license.PredictingLicenseService

fields.description:
I was used to our own hosted version of JIRA and loved it.  I still really like the functionality, but the performance of JIRA studio is really, really bugging me.  If you can put more horse power into your hosted site, that would be great!

Sometimes operations like Attach file are so slow I just don't know if they are failing or what, usually I give up.  Greenhopper refreshes are particularly annoying, since the planning page takes longer than usual to refresh.

Thanks,
 Brett
fields.summary: JIRA studio is too slow

This is probably the place to add it:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASTUDIO/Administering+Source

I made a small change but the DOC team may wish to review it.
fields.summary: Document SVN Commit Hooks

fields.description:
Parts of Studio depend on {{FisheyeAccessor}}, {{FisheyeUserManagerAccessor}} and {{FisheyeCommitAccessor}}. These should be rewritten to use proper FishEye APIs.

In general, Studio shouldn't depend on anything in the {{com.atlassian.sal.fisheye}} package, or any other product-specific SAL package.
fields.summary: Remove dependencies on FishEye SAL plugin implementation classes

fields.description: AOD-2618 explains why the exception handling in the GData Client (1.41.4) is suboptimal. Please check if the newer versions of the client still imply this 'contract' for 401 responses. If not, discuss with the team if the improved exception handling would justify the replacement of that library with a newer version. If the outcome of this discussion is positive, raise a ticket for the replacement specifying that once the library is replaced, the extra exception handling code in com.atlassian.agmp.gdata.impl.AuthenticatedMediaServiceImpl (com.atlassian.agmp:gdata-service-plugin) for this problem should be removed. If the AuthenticationException is still constructed fail-fast, raise an issue for that on http://code.google.com/p/gdata-java-client/issues/list .
fields.summary: Spike: Check exception handling in newer versions of GData client

fields.description:
If a conflict is detected and stored, and then the corresponding Gapps and Studio users are deleted, the conflict will be left behind and show up on the conflicts admin page.

The poller should perform a conflict clean up, deleting any conflicts stored that are no longer relevant.
fields.summary: Update user synchroniser to clean up orphan username conflicts

fields.description:
When using Google Chrome to view a Google Apps-enabled Studio instance, the page footer is obscured by the Activity Bar, which means none of the links are usable (see attached screenshots).

While Chrome is currently not a [supported browser|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASTUDIO/Supported+Platforms], it would be good to fix this problem as many people do use it.

When the doc theme is chosen in Studio 2.3, the activity bar obscures the footer in other browsers as well.

fields.description:
The following classes may be reused inside Studio and thus should be moved to studio-common module:

com.atlassian.studio.importer.impl.util.XStreamRestConverterTemplate - Template for REST providers using XStream to convert Java objects
com.atlassian.studio.importer.impl.util.SalBasedRestSecurityHelper - Helper for restricting access to REST services using the SAL UserManager
com.atlassian.studio.importer.impl.util.ZipFileInputStream - Helper for ZIP extraction
com.atlassian.studio.importer.util.PagedIterable<T> - Defines an interface for paged access to Iterable(s)
com.atlassian.studio.importer.util.SortablePagedIterable<T> - Defines an interface for sortable, paged access to Iterable(s)
com.atlassian.studio.importer.impl.util.PreFetchedPagedIterable - Default implementation for SortablePagedIterable<T> which requires all entities to be pre-fetched and stores them into memory

Extract reusable functionality out of  com.atlassian.studio.importer.impl.file.DefaultFileService (f.e. line replacing with regex)
fields.summary: Move reusable classes to studio-common

fields.description:
The tests for the Favicon and Logo code is not complete yet there are still a few more tests to be written:

# Test wether or not the height and width properties are the same as they have been set to.
# Test that the favicon works in every single app. The favicon works if the link to the favicon has link="icon" in it, and when you download it it is exactly the same as the image that you expect it to be (compare them byte by byte). For an example of how to do the download and compare to an existing image then look in here: https://studio.atlassian.com/source/browse/JST/trunk/studio-fireball/src/test/java/com/atlassian/studio/functest/TestLookAndFeel.java#r106417 
# Test that when you download the favicon and the Logo that the mime types that you get start with "image/"

That will make the favicon test robust.

fields.description:
Looking at our July statistics, over 2% of our total support load was related to customers needing us to configure their email issue creation settings.

It would be good if we were able to provide an interface so that customers could configure this themselves.
fields.summary: Allow customers to configure their own issue creation/comments from email services

fields.description:
Enabling Bamboo is currently about 6.5% of our total support load. It would be easier for Supporters and more satisfying to customers if Bamboo was enabled from the beginning.

Currently about 20% of Studio customers use Bamboo.

While unnecessary memory usage is a concern (its minimum heap size is currently 384MB by default), I think it would be less effort to disable Bamboo for customers who are running into memory problems and aren't using it. Additionally, this will eliminate the waiting period that eager customers currently experience.
fields.summary: Enable Bamboo by default

fields.description:
Currently, studio uses the following code or something similar in a number of places:
return userService.getOpenIdDomain(userService.findCrowdUserByName(getEditName())) != null

A lot of code will be cleaner if the API allowed this to be performed in a single call.
Add a method with the following signature to the com.atlassian.agmp.openid.users.mgmt.api.UserService interface:
  boolean isOpenIdUser(String username) throws com.atlassian.agmp.openid.users.mgmt.api.UserNotFoundException
fields.summary: Modify AGMP UserService API to include isOpenIdUser(String username) method and refactor studio to use this method where appropriate

The users currently get displayed on one page for the access level / username rename step. The display should be paged since there can be several hundred users in the import.

See also: https://studio.atlassian.com/wiki/display/JST/Customer+Facing+JIRA+Imports?focusedCommentId=37684227#comment-37684227)
fields.summary: Add paging for users

fields.description:
Tim and I were discussing the other day the need for uniform, unchanging monitored resources over HTTP.  Currently, monitoring the apps over HTTP is bit of moving target.  Often times a sensor will fail not because there is a problem, but the state of the application has changed.  This has forced us to lower the bar to the most basic pages and search strings available, which means that sometimes we can miss real problems.

What I'm after is a single resource in every application accessible over HTTP that:

1) tests the application is working properly using any method that makes sense
2) does not require login
3) will never redirect anywhere
4) does not depend on another application
5) works the same on gapps and non-gapps
6) works the same on for unauthorized gapps (redirect to gapp domain)
fields.summary: create or define HTTP monitored resources

fields.description:
After the upgrade to 2.2 in Studio 2.2, FishEye will sometimes start up in a bad state and only return 500 errors. While the error itself is different, it behaves very similarly to the problem discovered in FishEye 1.6.6.2 (AOD-1876), which affected Studio versions earlier than 2.1.

The error message itself is:

{noformat}
Your request was unable to be processed
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError

You are running release CR2.2.4 FE2.2.4 (build-488 2010-06-09), please report your release number when reporting bugs.
{noformat}

Restarting FishEye generally does the trick, although sometimes it will keep happening after a restart. If so hitting the following URL as soon as it comes up will force it to load the necessary classes to avoid the problem:
* <JIRA-Studio-URL>/source/rest-service/reviews-v1/versionInfo
This is the same workaround needed in AOD-1876.
